reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Lovely pools but bad service & appalling shower
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bandara in a Deluxe Room for 7 nights over the Christmas period. The resort was surprisingly fairly empty until boxing day when I would guess it was at around 70% capacity.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first we thought the resort was fantastic. As other reviewers have said, balcony is a decent size with a table, 2 chairs & a day bed. The 2 pools are of a decent size and there are some nice gardens.
reviews.title: Nice and quiet hotel

reviews.text: Unfortunately as you look closer there are many little things that are missing from a 4 star hotel - for starters, the shower is atrocious. It's in the same room as the toilet, seperated by a (rather short) shower curtain that is suspended by sheer luck - no bolts into the walls meant the rod and curtain kept falling down. Once you get into the shower you'll find little more than a dribble of water.
reviews.title: Great Resort
Best hotel we have stayed in!!!
reviews.text: Toiletries such as cotton buds and shower gel were only replenished once during our 7 nights, mini-bar was randomly replenished, beach towels and the 2 water bottles they supplied in the bathroom were replaced most days, but again, not regularly. When I called to have the water bottles sent up, the person on the phone was not impressed and promptly hung up on me (though the bottles did arrive 30 minutes later).
As another reviewer pointed out, although there are numerous (I believe 8) jacuzzi areas in the pool only 1 area was turned on intermittently over the 8 days we were there. The rest were not working.
reviews.title: Nice Interior but Bad Service. Improvement needed!

likes.liked: — Provision of beach bag and towels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in one of the villas. The rooms inside or the villa garden are not really that large, but its still a very beautiful concept. You have your own private sala (gazebo), plunge pool and outdoor bath / shower. The villas on the left side have plants to hide you from outside views while the villas on the right side have high bamboo walls, which may feel a bit odd, given that the garden is really not that big. The villas are nicely furnished and well kept.
reviews.title: Real Nice Hotel (if you stay in the villas)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free Wireless internet everywhere (slow though).. DV'D player in room. DVDs can be rented.
reviews.title: Spa bliss

reviews.text: Unfortunately, its also a "normal" hotel with most guests staying in three big mulit-storey buildings. I would not recommend these rooms as all balconies face inwards; i.e. you look into each other rooms. The side-effect is, that it can get quite crowded at breakfast and you may come across some sun-burned "spade & bucket" tourists, which you would not expect to see in a more upmarket hotel. But there is really no reason to leave your villa except for breakfast. Service was good.
reviews.title: Memorable 50th

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only negative experience was at check-out, when the staff tried to charge a cancellation fee for early departure, which was significantly higher than had we stayed until the end..
reviews.title: Great resort - apart from children's behaviors...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sand at Bo Phut Beach is not very fine and the slope is quite steep - not ideal for children. However, there are lots of nice beach restaurants.
reviews.title: What a jem to discover!

likes.liked: — Resort was well laid out everything in easy reach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bandara for 8 nights during May/June.
reviews.title: Great room, lovely people, beautiful place!

likes.disliked: — No clocks in the rooms and overpriced spa treatments

reviews.title: When can we go back??
reviews.text: Arrival:

reviews.title: Absolutely Sensational
reviews.text: We were impressed straight away when on arrival we were seated by the friendly staff for a refreshing welcome drink and a treat, whilst they got our paperwork in order. We were then escorted to our room and given a quick tour and explanation of the room and the resorts facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Resort:
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.text: The building itself, the restaurants, pools, and the rooms are all modern, clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. The resort grounds and gardens are also immaculate.
reviews.title: Perfect Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Bandara in mid June for 5 nights. From the moment we arrived we felt extremely welcome. Our room was exactly as we requested - on the top floor of the Sunrise wing overlooking the pool. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, our bed was decorated and the bath filled with rose petals. We also received a bottle of champagne and a cake.
reviews.title: Blissful Bandara

likes.liked: — The beautiful grounds, the pools, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Not being able to swim in the sea.

reviews.text: Our room was spacious and the balcony was large with a daybed and overhead fan, perfect for sitting sipping champagne while listening to Madeline Peyroux on the excellent sound system. Loved the little extras like the peanut toffees next to the bed on our return at night and the beach basket which was SO handy. The rooms are very solid and we heard no noise from surrounding guests.
reviews.title: lovely hotel

likes.disliked: — beach ( but that's not the hotels fault)

reviews.text: Met some lovely people at the Managers Cocktail Party including Steven (the Manager) who is a wonderful guy. It's easy to see why the staff seem so happy, relaxed and friendly when they have such a great boss!
reviews.title: Average, poor service

reviews.text: The grounds are well established and beautifully maintained. We loved the choice of pools. We used the 47metre one for laps each morning and the two beach pools during the day. Tried swimming in the sea but was completely turned off by the slimy muddy feel on the bottom.
reviews.title: Wonderful holiday

reviews.text: The hotel is ideally situated in the middle of Bophut beach. A ten minute walk either to Fishermans Village or to the Zazen Hotel. Mind you, it is not an easy walk as the sand is like fresh, deep snow. Your feet sink in and it really is a great workout for your calves! There is also no need for a foot scrub from one of the massage huts as the sand is so coarse your feet become very smooth and soft!
reviews.title: Loved the grounds
